thread.title: NFL: Big Ben has shot to face the Chiefs - Football
thread.title_full: NFL: Big Ben has shot to face the Chiefs - Football - NorthJersey.com

author: FROM NEWS SERVICE REPORTS |
title: NFL: Big Ben has shot to face the Chiefs - Football
text:
The Pittsburgh Steelers left open the possibility QB Ben Roethlisberger could return to action after a three-game absence Sunday for their game at Kansas City.
Roethlisberger was listed as questionable on Friday's injury report after being a limited participant in practice for a third straight day. He has been out since straining the MCL in his left knee Sept. 27 in a win at St. Louis.
Backup Mike Vick was ruled out. He strained his right hamstring last Sunday in a victory over Arizona and did not practice all week.
Third-stringer Landry Jones replaced Vick in the third quarter, earned the win, and is the presumptive starter this week.
TITANS' MARIOTA OUT: Titans rookie QB Marcus Mariota will not play Sunday against Atlanta as he recovers from a sprained MCL in his left knee. Zach Mettenberger will start.
Coach Ken Whisenhunt said Mariota has been ruled out after missing practice all week and the rookie's knee has not healed up. 
"It's a combination of missing practice and not quite being there [physically]," Whisenhunt said.
BRIEFS: Johnny Manziel is expected to remain the Browns' backup QB as the NFL investigates whether he violated its personal conduct policy during an alleged incident involving his girlfriend two weeks ago. … Bills WR Percy Harvin remained in the U.S. for "a personal reason" while the team practiced in London, GM Doug Whaley said. … Chargers TE Antonio Gates (knee) is questionable for this weekend. Meanwhile, political strategist Mark Fabiani, speaking on behalf of the Chargers, told XPRS-AM that the franchise plans for file for relocation to Los Angeles in January. … Ravens WR Steve Smith said he would quit if the team traded him.
